thread.title: Hillary Clinton emails: She, State aides discussed publicizing use of home email addresses
thread.title_full: Hillary Clinton emails: She, State aides discussed publicizing use of home email addresses - POLITICO

author: Michael Hirsh
title: Hillary Clinton emails: She, State aides discussed publicizing use of home email addresses
text:
Though her use of a personal email account is now a weight on her presidential aspirations, Hillary Clinton apparently thought in 2011 it would be a good idea to publicize the regular use of personal email accounts by high-level State Department officials — a message intended to pressure Congress to update antiquated agency technology and stave off further budget cuts. "I think this makes good sense," Clinton wrote in an email response to a June 2011 suggestion from adviser Anne-Marie Slaughter, who sugested issuing a statement or op-ed that indicates "even high officials routinely end up using their home email accounts to be able to get their work done quickly and effectively."
The public approach was ultimately scrapped. Clinton chief of staff Cheryl Mills suggested it might be a mistake to "telegraph how much folks do or don't do off state mail b/c it may encourage others who are out there" — and that publicizing the use of home email addresses could encourage others to do it, leaving them at risk of being hacked. Mills noted that she was on the receiving end of an attempted email hack herself.
Slaughter then replied that a better approach might be for Clinton herself to make the point quietly to lawmakers.
Clinton worried about Fox media storm over 'mother' and 'father' passport issue By Nick Gass
The email exchange was released on Wednesday as part of the State Department's latest public disclosure of Clinton's messages from her times as secretary of state.
